issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

components.name: Appcelerator CLI
components.description: Please enter tickets related to Tooling and the CLI here

components.name: Titanium SDK & CLI
components.description: Please enter tickets related to the MobileSDK here.

fields.description:
Hello,

We are having a module built for our application, and after adding the module and running the app for Android, we are receiving the following error.

The files are not in the same directory, Im confused at how this can be seen as a duplicate file?  Is there any way to force delete duplicates or ignore them?

Thanks,
Eric

[ERROR] Failed to package application:
[ERROR]
[ERROR] /Users/x/Documents/Appcelerator_Studio_Workspace/AppceleratorRebuild/build/android/res/drawable-xhdpi/common_full_open_on_phone.png: error: Duplicate file.
[ERROR] /Users/x/Documents/Appcelerator_Studio_Workspace/AppceleratorRebuild/build/android/res/drawable-xhdpi-v4/common_full_open_on_phone.png: Original is here. The version qualifier may be implied.
fields.summary: Duplicate file in Android .jar/.aar causing build failure

comments.body: Hello, Please provide a sample app for us to test the issue, also provide a guide on how to test the issue for successful regeneration. I would suggest upgrading your SDK and CLI to the latest one. Thanks.

Hi Sharif, 

Just for the record, if anyone comes across this issue.

We "resolved" this issue by removing ti.map/<latest version>/platform/android/res, and removing the google play base and basement .jars from any other modules.  

Hopefully 7.0.0 and the new way play services is being handled will improve on this issue.

Thanks
Eric
